page.title: 01LOOKING AT CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: The block in which we live has two villages and two housing developments. Cherry Willingham is the largest of the villages with a population of about 3000. Reepham is much smaller and lies to the N.W. of Cherry Willingham. Hawthorn Rd. estate lies to the E. of Cherry Willingham and toward Lincoln (which is 6km. away). N.Greetwell lies on the main road to Skegness which passes diagonally from E. to N.W. The main Lincoln to Grimsby railway line passes through both villages. The general terain is slightly undulating (by Lincs. standards) and both villages have many trees around (which is unusual for the area). The area around the villages is farmland with a roadstone quarry in the S.W. corner.
